result.execSummary:
All charges against Eferin Z. Dixon in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eferin Z. Dixon is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:05 AM Defendant Eferin Z. Dixon in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Joseph Patrick Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  The Court orders the defendant to report to room 226 after Court today to sign the signature bond that was amended on March 9, 2022.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney request to adjourn
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 04-04-2022. "Change to status on prelim. Marsy's Law at issue. Defendant to be in court, attorney may appear in person, or via Zoom to select new date. Time limits have been waived"
appointing Attorney Jessica Klein
Letter from Atty. Eryn Menden advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
Hearing on April 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED 03-09-2022:  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS: Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:53 AM Defendant Eferin Z. Dixon in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden states she just found out this morning that this is a re-filed case and needs to check with Attorney Klein to see if she will be representing the defendant in this case as she previously represented the defendant.  Court will set this matter for a status of counsel and status of preliminary hearing date.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Court amends the bond to include the DNA provision.  Defendant to report to room C226 after Court today to sign the amended bond.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
